decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON:  To comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.
Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents: Design & Access Statement;  Letter dated 8th September 2022; Letter from SEND Strategy Programme Lead dated 8 July 2020; Enviroscreen Environmental Assessment dated 29 March 2022; Traffic Noise Impact Assessment [ref: 17489-NIA-01 dated 09 May 2022]; Transport Statement [dated 17/05/22]; Location Plan; Existing Ground Floor Plan; Existing First Floor Plan; Roof Plan; Existing Ground Floor Plan ; Proposed First Floor Plan; Fire Policy Document; Reasonable Exemption Statement
REASON: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

Condition : 3 - Unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Development Authority, the premises shall only be used for the purposes of Red Balloon Learner Centre and not for any other use including other uses falling within use class F1A.   

REASON: To ensure any future change of use or occupier is compatible with the surrounding residential area and would not result in undue traffic or disturbance impacts, and to ensure that sufficient quality outdoor amenity space and facilities are provided for future users of the site, in accordance with policies S3 and T4 of The London Plan (2021) and policies DM1, DM46, DM42, DM44 and DM45 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013). 
Condition : 4 - Prior to occupation of the development, details of shelters, racks, dimensions and location of a minimum of 3 long stay and 2 short stay cycle parking spaces shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The cycle storage shall be made available prior to occupation and shall be retained thereafter.

REASON: To ensure the satisfactory provision of safe cycle storage facilities, to provide facilities for all the users of the site and in the interests of highway safety and sustainable transport, in accordance with policy T5 of The London Plan (2021) and policy DM 42 of the Harrow Development Management Policies (2013).
Condition : 5 - Prior to the occupation of the development hereby permitted, a full Delivery and Service Plan, and details relating to the layout of the rear car parking area, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. This shall include:
  a) Servicing and delivery information including waste storage and collection; 
  b) Plans showing the rear parking area that would be used for servicing and deliveries, the inclusion of at least 1 disabled parking space on site and a reduction in the number of existing car parking spaces; and
  c) The introduction of any soft landscaping features which would be made possible by the reduction in parking spaces. 

 The Delivery and Service Plan and parking layout thereby approved shall be adhered to thereafter. 

REASON: To ensure that the development does not harm the safety and free flow of the public highway, accords with the London Plan with regard to provision of parking and promotion of sustainable travel, and to improve the character and quality of facilities on site, in accordance with policy T7 of The London Plan (2021) and policies DM42, DM44 and DM45 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013). 
Condition : 6 - Prior to the occupation of the development hereby permitted, a Travel Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. This shall include:
a) A full travel plan developed in line with TfL guidance and Mayoral targets;
b) A travel plan coordinator to be appointed at least 2 months occupation and details of the coordinator supplied to Travel Planning Officers;
c) A commitment to annual travel surveys included within the plan, of which the first will form baseline data; 
d) Ambitious targets over a 5-year period; 
e) A full action plan included within the travel plan; and
f) Confirmation that the school has signed up to TfL STARS accreditation (Bronze by Year 1, Silver by Year 3 and Gold by year 5)
Unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority. The details thereby approved shall be adhered to for a period of 5 years thereafter.

REASON: To promote sustainable modes of travel for the future occupies of the development, in accordance with T4 of The London Plan (2021), policy CS1.R of Harrow Core Strategy (2012) and policy DM43 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013)
